snippet: The recession and its aftermath have forced many older people who are out of work to draw Social Security earlier than they had planned.
abstract: Recession and its protracted aftermath have forced many older unemployed Americans to draw Social Security much earlier than they had planned; early withdrawals have significant economic repercussions that are likely to plague retirees even if the economy revives.
lead_paragraph: The recession and its aftermath have forced many older people who are out of work to draw Social Security earlier than they had planned.

headline.seo: Older, Jobless and Forced Onto Social Security
headline.main: Forced to Early Social Security, Unemployed Pay a Steep Price
headline.print_headline: Forced to Early Social Security, Unemployed Pay a Steep Price
